FuncDef:
The direct-route track vrrp interface command associates direct routes with a Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP) backup group in the loopback interface view.
The undo direct-route track vrrp interface command deletes the association between direct routes and a VRRP group in the loopback interface view. The direct-route track vrrp interface command associates direct routes with a Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP) backup group in the loopback interface view. The undo direct-route track vrrp interface command deletes the association between direct routes and a VRRP group in the loopback interface view. By default, direct routes are not associated with a VRRP group.
CLIs: direct-route track vrrp interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } vrid <virtual-router-id> degrade-cost <cost-value>
undo direct-route track vrrp [ interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } vrid <virtual-router-id> degrade-cost <cost-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of the interface on which a VRRP group is configured.
-

Specifies the number of the interface on which a VRRP group is configured.
-

Specifies the ID of a VRRP group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Specifies a cost to be applied to IP direct routes when the associated VRRP group is in the Backup or Initialize state.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-loopback1] direct-route track vrrp interface 100GE1/0/1 vrid 1 degrade-cost 300
ExtraInfo: Two CloudEdge-GWs in equipment room run VRRP, which is deployed on Eth-Trunk interfaces. Packets are transparently transmitted through an AGG-SW. The priority of network segment routes on loopback interfaces is associated with the VRRP status, and the priority of network segment routes on loopback interfaces of the CloudEdge-GW in the Backup state is low.
